Authors:
Miriam I. Hutchinson, Amy Jo Powell, Donald O. Natvig, John
W. Taylor, Adrian Tsang
Title:
Mycothermus thermophilus gen. et comb. nov. A new home for
the itinerant thermophile Scytalidium thermophilum (Torula
thermophila).
Keywords:
Mycothermus, Scytalidium, Chaetomiaceae, Sordariales,
thermophilic fungi
Abstract:
Thermophilic fungi have received substantial attention in
industry for their potential to produce thermostable enzymes and as
production platforms tolerant of high temperature. Studies exploring the
ecology and biosystematics of thermophilic fungi have lagged behind
studies in applied biology. The species most recently known as
Scytalidium thermophilum (Chaetomiaceae) is one of the most frequently
encountered organisms in surveys of thermophilic fungi. There is
evidence that it is ecologically and economically important, for example
in the context of commercial mushroom growing. As described here, this
species should not be placed in the genus Scytalidium or any other
existing genus. We propose a new genus and combination, Mycothermus
thermophilus.
